meanings.definition: A layer of material, naturally or artificially formed.
meanings.sent1: The archaeologists uncovered a stratum of ancient pottery shards.
meanings.sent2: The geologist studied the different strata of rock in the canyon.
meanings.sent3: The stratum of colorful leaves on the ground made a beautiful pattern.
meanings.sent4: The stratum of dust on the bookshelf revealed its long neglect.
meanings.sent5: The stratum of clouds in the sky resembled fluffy cotton candy.

meanings.definition: A level or class in a social hierarchy.
meanings.sent1: In the company, the executives occupied the highest stratum of power.
meanings.sent2: The medieval society had a strict stratum system with nobles at the top.
meanings.sent3: The stratum of popular kids in school always sat together at lunch.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she didn't belong to any stratum of the social circles.
meanings.sent5: The royal family belonged to the highest stratum of society.

meanings.definition: A layer of tissue or cells in an organism.
meanings.sent1: The skin is composed of an outer stratum that protects the body.
meanings.sent2: The biologist examined the cellular strata of the plant under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: The stratum of muscle tissue in the body works together to enable movement.
meanings.sent4: The stratum of cells in the leaf helps in the process of photosynthesis.
meanings.sent5: The inner stratum of the skin contains important nerve endings.
